_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.    Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies:



SSF production is handling propane/butane mixture which is considered hazardous by the EPA. In order to avoid fires and accidents SSF developed an internal safety system as follows:

     Safety concept of SSF-Production:



-    Monitored ventilation system:    Suction. The ventilation system sucks the building air at all potential gas emission points. Thus, an accumulation of the gas is prevented and prevented the emergence of an explosive  atmosphere. 



-    Air condition humidity control:     All buildings at SSF are equipped with an air humidification system which ensures a humidity air level of more than 40%. If this level is not reached, a security system is installed which immediately triggers an internal alarm and indicates the malfunction of this system



-    Gas detection system:    The gas / air concentration is constantly measured and monitored in the buildings and especially around the extruder. If the gas / air concentration exceeds 20% or 40% of the LEL (lower explosion limit), various measures are taken of the individual buildings or extrusion plants).



-    Antistatic equipment    The extrusion lines are equipped with anti-static fans and rods (ionization blowers and bars) . These minimize static charge of the foam.



-    1 Person always required in the Building: Each production building (Bldg. 47/49) must be staffed with at least one person at all times. Thus, potential risks, fires, malfunctions at the extrusion plants can be detected earlier and countermeasures can be taken.



-    Fire prevention / firefighting    All employees of SSF-Production are trained annually.



-    Fire alarm system (ionization detector, heat detector, multi-sensor detector):    All Buildings are equipped with fire alarms that trigger a fire alarm in the event of a fire. The notification of the fire department is automatic. In addition, the alarm will be displayed in all halls of SSF - all trained fire fighters will go to the affect

ed hall for help. In case of fire or an electrical defect of a fire alarm, an automatic notification (call, email) to the fire protection officer or his representative. Heat detectors installed in the tent area and in the future above each of the film blowing heads.



-    sprinkler system: Is installed in all buildings and triggers in case of fire.



-    Integrated SSF Safety System     In order to avoid accidents and to be able to react quickly to solve unexpected incidents, SSF has installed an internal alarm system which triggers different alarms such as fire / gas / faults detected and on the respective alarm displays of the Buildings



In order to evaluate / test and initiate further continuous improvements to increase safety and reliability when handling LPG (butane / propane), an FMEA of the LPG system is implemented by SSF Production.

The following goals are pursued in detail:

- record and evaluate current status of Safety / PSM

- Identify and assess security vulnerabilities and threats

- Develop suggestions for improvement and implement them promptly

- Define a target or target state, which helps or serves as a basis for the design and planning of new plants.



This safety system has been active within SSF since the start of liquefied gas utilization and has been continuously developed and improved over the years.

For this reason, very strict standards were set for the system in the evaluation.

    

Our emergency response program is based upon the OSHA-PSM regulation and communicated and agreed by CLINTON COUNTY EMERGENCY response and the SOUTH PLATTSBURGH FIRE DEPARTMENT



2. Stationary source and regulated substances handled.



SSF production LLC is manufacturer of extruded polystyrene foam, wherein a blowing agent (Propane/Butane-Mix) is injected at high pressure into one of the three existing extrusion lines which contain polystyrene resin. 

Once the plastic + pressurized gas exits the film blowing head of the extruder, the pressure is relieved, an

d the gas expands within the plastic resin as it cools.

The extruded and cooled sheet material is then transferred to the winder station where it gets rolled up and packaged. The finished good (Roll) is stored in the warehouse until it gets shipped.

Access to site (fenced gas station) is restricted to authorized facility employees, authorized management personnel and authorized contactors The regulated substance handled at this production facility is propane/butane- 50/50 mixture. The maximum intended inventory of propane/butane is 67,835 lbs.



3. Worst case release scenario and alternative release scenario



WORST CASE SCENARIO: Failure of one of the storage gas tanks when filled to the greatest amount allowed would release 33,917 lbs of propane/butane gas mixture. The company policy limits the maximum filling capacity of those tanks to 85%. It is assumed that the entire contents are released as a vapor cloud which finds an ignition source 10% of the released quantity is assumed to participate in the resulting explosion. The distance to the endpoint of 1 PSI is 0.30 miles.



Alternative Scenario: A pull away causing failure of the fill hose. Following valves and actions would happen:

-    The Excess flow valves would stop the flow

-    The gate valves would shut automatically due to loss of pressure coming from the gas truck.

-    The nitrogen nylon lines would be ripped off due to the pulling truck. By loosing the nitrogen pressure, nitrogen actuated spring-loaded valves would shut off the gas flow in the production and at the gas farm station.
